title: The ITLF (Kuki-Zo Organisation in Manipur) declares "self-rule"
selftext:
The ITLF has declared "self-rule" with the Kuki-Zo community having a separate government with a separate Chief Minister. 
Its General Secretary said the following:
"We don't care if the Centre does not recognise us. 
The Kuki-Zo people have been 'hurt' by the remarks of the Union Home Minister calling them 'illegal immigrants '". 
The Kuki-Zo People have a vision of congregating areas where their people live (Manipur, Mizoram, Chin district of Myanmar and Chittagong hills of Bangladesh) and create a separate nation for themselves.

Is this Constitutionally legal?

Source: https://www.indiatoday.in/india/story/manipur-violence-update-kuki-meitei-communities-clash-self-ruled-separate-administration-dead-injured-2463594-2023-11-16
